headline.main: NAZIS SEE NO SIGNS OF SPREADING WAR; Expect Turks and Bulgarians to Retain Neutral Stand on Italo-Greek Conflict OWN POSITION UNCHANGED Germany Has Not Broken Off Relations With Greece, but Backs Rome Fully

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Oct. 31--Germany's relations with Greece after the invasion of that country by Italy remain unchanged, it was authoritatively stated here today. Meanwhile the Reich Government is examining the situation in the light of its commitments to Italy under the Axis alliance.
